meanings.definition: Not able to be done or accomplished.
meanings.sent1: The task was undoable due to its complexity.
meanings.sent2: It was an undoable dream for him to fly without wings.
meanings.sent3: Trying to finish the puzzle in one minute was undoable!
meanings.sent4: Her request for a unicorn was as undoable as asking for a rainbow-colored elephant.
meanings.sent5: The mountain was so high that climbing it seemed undoable.

meanings.sent1: The irreversible decision was truly undoable.
meanings.sent2: Once the ink dried, the signature became undoable.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to unsend the email was undoable and hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The shattered vase was an undoable mess on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The damage caused by the storm was undoable and heartbreaking.
